Wow, I'd heard the hype about the #RStats apaTables package but I didn't realise HOW easy it was. It spits out APA formatted tables with literally one line of code! Plus, you can edit them afterwards in Word (e.g. make variable names non-strings).

You won't believe this one trick for learning gganimate*: Just mention it to students once, then assign an open-ended project. Every other student will try to use it and you'll learn while helping them. #rstats 

*trick works for most things, but esp. for gganimate and shiny!
